description: This course examines religion in Italy and Germany at several decisive turning points in the past and today. Students analyze Catholic theology and church practices, from ancient times to the Renaissance, through site visits and events in Rome (city of the popes) and Florence. They examine emergence of Protestantism through activities in the region around Wittenberg, birthplace of Martin Luther's Reformation. They compare the influence of religion in Italian and German culture. Prequisite: BTS-B. Offered periodically during Interim.
name: Rome and Wittenberg
notes: This is an off-campus course. You will find this course listed in Studio Abroad under its course title.
title: Catholic Rome, Lutheran Wittenberg
